result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence Lee Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during period of Extended Supervision or civil judgment.  DV surcharge does not apply.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
*6/9/2015 credit amended to 64 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
No firearms, weapons (felon).

Successfully complete anger managment, and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete  any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Supervised in contacts with children and victims.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfuly complete recommended treatment.   Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

DOC request to review sentence credit.

Defendant Terrence Lee Martin in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Terrence Lee Martin in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence), with credit for 273 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete Anger Management, 
   and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* Supervised in contacts with children and victim. 
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons. (felon).
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of extended supervision 
   or CIVIL JUDGMENT. 
   ---(dv surcharge does not apply)
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
 Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 01-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Lee Martin in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Terrence Lee Martin in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  All conditions of bail are continued, per order of the Court.  mld

Defendant Terrence Lee Martin in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Terrence Lee Martin in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 received and filed.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Child Abuse Recklessly Cause Harm, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 948.03(3)(b), a Class I Felony."   mld

  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Barbara Court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.
